meta.name: Convert and Manipulate PDFs with Api2Pdf and AWS Lambda

name: Api2Pdf - PDF Generation, Powered by AWS Lambda MCP Server

parameters.content:
### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: 
Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Configure Authentication**: 
Set up apiKey credentials
   - Type: API Key in header
   - Key name: Authorization

3. **Activate Workflow**:
Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: 
Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**:
Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration


### üí° Usage Notes
‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 9 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure


### üõ†Ô∏è Customization
‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### üí¨ Need Help?
Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for integration guidance and custom automations. Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) for more information.

## üõ†Ô∏è Api2Pdf - PDF Generation, Powered by AWS Lambda MCP Server ‚úÖ 9 operations

### About
Introduction [Api2Pdf](https://www.api2pdf.com) is a powerful PDF generation API with no rate limits or file size constraints. Api2Pdf runs on AWS Lambda, a serverless architecture powered by Amazon to scale to millions of requests while being up to 90% cheaper than alternatives. **Supports wkhtmltopdf, Headless Chrome, LibreOffice, and PDF Merge.** You can also generate barcodes with ZXING (Zebra Crossing). SDKs & Client Libraries We've made a number of open source libraries available for the API - Python: [https://github.com/api2pdf/api2pdf.python](https://github.com/api2pdf/api2pdf.python) - .NET: [https://github.com/api2pdf/api2pdf.dotnet](https://github.com/api2pdf/api2pdf.dotnet) - Nodejs: [https://github.com/api2pdf/api2pdf.node](https://github.com/api2pdf/api2pdf.node) - PHP: [https://github.com/Api2Pdf/api2pdf.php](https://github.com/Api2Pdf/api2pdf.php) - Ruby: (Coming soon) Authorization Create an account at [portal.api2pdf.com](https://portal.api2pdf.com/register) to get an API key. **Authorize your API calls** - GET requests, include apikey=YOUR-API-KEY as a query string parameter - POST requests, add **Authorization** to your header. ``` Authorization: YOUR-API-KEY ``` Quickstart If you are looking for just a quick call to grab PDFs of a URL, you can do a GET request like: ``` https://v2018.api2pdf.com/chrome/url?url={UrlToConvert}&apikey={YourApiKey} ``` For more advanced usage and settings, see the API specification below.

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the Api2Pdf - PDF Generation, Powered by AWS Lambda API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://v2018.api2pdf.com
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent


### üìã Available Operations (9 endpoints)

**Headless Chrome (3 operations)**
convert

**Libre Office (1 operations)**
convert

**Merge / Combine Pdfs (1 operations)**
merge

**W K Html To Pdf (3 operations)**
convert

**Zxing (zebra Crossing) Bar Codes (1 operations)**
generate

nodes.name: Api2Pdf - PDF Generation, Powered by AWS Lambda MCP Server

parameters.name: url
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('url', 'Url of the page to convert to PDF. Must start with http:// or https://.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: output
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('output', 'Specify output=json to receive a JSON output. Defaults to PDF file.', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Convert URL to PDF

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ url (required) - Url of the page to convert to PDF. Must start with http:// or https://.
  ‚Ä¢ output (optional) - Specify output=json to receive a JSON output. Defaults to PDF file.

Parameters:

nodes.name: Generate bar codes and QR codes with ZXING.

parameters.name: value
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('value', 'Specify the text value you want to convert', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Generate bar codes and QR codes with ZXING.

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ format (required) - Most common is CODE_39 or QR_CODE
  ‚Ä¢ value (required) - Specify the text value you want to convert
  ‚Ä¢ showlabel (optional) - Show label of text below barcode
  ‚Ä¢ height (optional) - Height of the barcode generated image
  ‚Ä¢ width (optional) - Width of the barcode generated image
